Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based web application for sentiment analysis of movie reviews that includes classification, user feedback handling, and data persistence.

Class Description: ReviewClassifier is a Flask web application class that performs sentiment analysis on movie reviews using a pre-trained classifier. It handles user submissions, provides classification results, processes feedback, and stores data in an SQLite database.

Attributes:
- app: Flask - The Flask application instance
- clf: sklearn classifier - Pre-trained sentiment classifier loaded from pickle file
- db: str - Path to the SQLite database file for storing reviews

Methods:
- __init__() -> None - Initializes the Flask app, loads classifier, and sets up routes
- _setup_routes() -> None - Configures Flask routes for the web application
- classify(document: str) -> tuple[str, float] - Classifies a review document and returns (label, probability)
- train(document: str, y: int) -> None - Updates classifier with new training data
- sqlite_entry(document: str, y: int) -> None - Stores review and sentiment in database
- index() -> str - Renders the main review submission form (HTML)
- results() -> str - Processes form submission and renders classification results (HTML)
- feedback() -> str - Handles user feedback and updates model/database (HTML)
- run(debug: bool = True) -> None - Starts the Flask development server
